DOC.brief_title: Motor Imagery Reach-to-grasp Rehabilitation After Tetraplegia
DOC.criteria: 1855 year old , quadriplegia elicit spinal cord injury ( SCI ) C5 , C5C6 , C6 , C6C7 level , complete infralesional motor deficit accord ASIA impairment scale finger forearm flexor muscle paralysis , posttraumatic period > 6 month ( since motor recovery plateau usually reach 6month postSCI nonstabilized hypertension pathological autonomic nervous system dysfunction ( e.g. , orthostatic hypotension ) , cerebral damage and/or cognitive deficit , elbow shoulder joint amplitude restriction , upper limb paraosteoarthropathy , participation another study presence metallic object within body incompatible MEG functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) recording .
